reviews.text: Location - It did take over an hour to transfer from Girona airport in rush hour, however only half that time on the return leg earlier in the morning. The hotel is 5 to 10 mins walk via an underpass to the beach. close to the bars and shops etc.

we stayed here as a group for football tournement at easter, rooms were basic but clean ,staff friendly, bar 'till 2am, food basic good and plentyful, lots of alternatives along the street, including burgerking for kids.shops and public transport out side your door .drunken duck english bar down the street for sky sports and food. All round good cheap basic hotel.
reviews.title: great basic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just returned from hotel after short 3 night stay.the hotel is located in a nice location on main strip with lots of bars and plenty of night life close by.we stayed half board,i think we may have been a little unlucky as there was a large football competition on and there was a lot of teams in the area.the hotel is a little dated but not to bad however i found the food a problem very little choice and not very nice...i am not a fussy eater but was not impressed with any of the food.it is out of season so we were probably just there at a time when the season is getting underway.and will no doubt improve,hotel was expensive for drinks,but most hotels are

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first room we was given was on the ground floor and was a bit dark and miserable. This had a patio area outside with table and chairs. The next day my butty asked at reception if we could move to a room with a balcony, we were given another room the same day..about 2 hours later! This room was much better, it was light and fresh! Our balcony looked out over the main street where there is a nice little British pub called the station! They do a nice big glass of baileys with ice and just so happened to have a welsh flag hanging up....TIDY MUN!!!
reviews.title: Hmm... it was ok...

likes.disliked: — Queuing for badd food in the basement restaurant

reviews.text: The Alhambra is a charming hotel that is a delight to stay at. All areas are spotless at all times and the staff are friendly. We went 1/2 board and ate well all week. The choices were a little narrower some days but there was always a good selection and it was well cooked. We did have to queue for a couple of minutes on 2 mornings but that was only because they weren't trying to rush the guests.
reviews.title: Excellent value
absolutely fabulous
reviews.text: The hotel is right on the front and a subway takes you under the train track to the beach. I have to say the beach was a bit of a let down as the sand was razor sharp and the entry to the sea was too steep for young ones but there is a cheap and reliable train service that can take those that want it down to Callela (which is quiet but better suited to small children).

You could also take a trip into Barcelona, if you do I would suggest getting off at the Arc de Triumph and having a gentle stroll down to the Zoo then on to the harbour and the shopping mall, it only takes a few minutes and you can then stroll up the Ramblas and get back on the train at Catalunya station.
